page.title: 09Sport:Gillamoor and Hutton.
page.content: Hunting,shooting and fishing all take place in their seasons.The fishing is private. Trout mainly are caught.The Lord of Spaunton Manor has the moor- land shooting rights,where grouse are shot. He also rears and shoots pheasants in woods bordering the moor. The shooting rights of the rest of the area belong mainly to another big land -owner.Local people also enjoy shoot- ing rabbits,hares and clay-pigeons.The Sinnington Hunt includes this area and they hold their annual Hunt Ball in Hutton Village Hall. Hutton has a very good bowling green and matches are played against other local village teams.There is a tennis court,recently completely repaired with money raised by the tennis club. Gillamoor has a football team (with Farndale) and a cricket team. Each village also has a darts team playing at their local pubs
